item.title: Hacker Wipes White Supremacist Websites While Dressed As The Pink Power Ranger
item.content:encoded:
Not all heroes wear capes. Some of them wear show-accurate Power Rangers cosplay. That‚Äôs what an anonymous hacker going by the pseudonym Martha Root did at a recent hacking conference where they used their hacking skills to delete white supremacist websites live on stage while dressed as the pink ranger.

The Chaos Communication Congress is an annual convention held by the Chaos Computer Club in Hamburg, Germany. Root gave a presentation there alongside journalists Eva Hoffmann and Christian Fuchs which concluded with the hacker deleting the servers of white supremacist sites WhiteDate, WhiteChild, and WhiteDeal live on stage.

As TechCrunch lays out, these three sites are dedicated to racist match making, racist egg and sperm donations, and a racist labor marketplace. White people use these sites to make sure they only link up with other white people. The administrator of these sites confirmed on X the servers were deleted in an act of ‚Äúcyberterrorism.‚Äù

Root also published personal data from these sites, including profile images and other information, but is holding back emails, passwords, and private conversations ‚Äúfor now.‚Äù The gender disparity in these sites is pretty telling, with Root noting that 86 percent of users were men, with women making up the additional 14 percent, a split they say ‚Äúmakes the Smurfs village look like a feminist utopia.‚Äù

‚ÄúImagine calling yourselves the ‚Äòmaster race‚Äô but forgetting to secure your own website ‚Äî maybe try mastering to host WordPress before world domination,‚Äù Root said. 

‚ÄºÔ∏èA German hacker known as "Martha Root" dressed as a pink Power Ranger and deleted a white supremacist dating website live onstage

This happened during the recent CCC conference.

Martha had infiltrated the site, ran her own AI chatbot to extract as much information from users‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/vpTEoFR8JR

‚Äî International Cyber Digest (@IntCyberDigest) January 2, 2026

Slay. Go, go Power Ranger.



https://kotaku.com/martha-root-hacker-white-supremacists-power-ranger-2000656764
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Lego Fit A Whole-Ass Computer Inside A Single Brick To Make Star Wars Sounds
item.content:encoded:
Lego announced a big step forward in how kids will play with the company‚Äôs popular plastic bricks. Well, it‚Äôs actually really small. In fact, Lego‚Äôs new Smart Brick is the size of a standard 4√ó2 Lego brick, but it contains much of the same tech found in modern phones. And Lego is promising some cool features that will be powered by this new, tiny tech.

On January 5, during the 2026 Consumer Electronics Show, Lego unveiled Smart Play, a new smart system of Lego pieces that will work with all pre-existing Lego bricks. The main star of Smart Play is the Smart Brick, which basically acts as a tiny PC and the brains of any set using Smart Play. And this new Smart Brick is packed with tech. Lego says it includes light-sensing and sound-sensing sensors and accelerometers, as well as a ‚Äúminiature speaker driven by an onboard synthesiser‚Äù and a custom-built microchip that is smaller than a standard Lego stud. The Smart Brick is charged wirelessly and can snap into any set like a regular brick.

So what can this new Smart Brick do? Well, if you include some of the other Smart Play Lego pieces, like Smart Tiles or Smart Minifigs, into a build, the Smart Brick can react to how kids play. For example, in a video posted by Lego, you can see kids attaching a propeller to a dinosaur, and when the propeller spins, the connected Smart Brick plays helicopter noises.

In the Star Wars sets launching with Smart Play in March, the Emperor minifig will play the Imperial March when you sit him on this throne. Ships can blast at each other with laser noises, and lightsabers will hum and whirl when figures holding them are moved.

Perhaps the most impressive part of all of this is that Lego has designed the system not to need a phone or computer. There is seemingly no app needed for any of these new Smart bits, which should make it very easy for a kid and their parents to set this up. In theory, you start building, and the Smart pieces interact as programmed. Sounds cool, and much better than some of Lego‚Äôs past attempts to combine tech and bricks, which often felt clunky and cumbersome as they involved phones, updates, cables, and other junk.

We won‚Äôt have to wait too long to see if Lego‚Äôs big promises are real, as Smart Play is set to launch in three different Lego Star Wars sets in March.



https://kotaku.com/lego-smart-play-brick-star-wars-march-interactive-sets-2000656727
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: That Surprise Splinter Cell-Like From Last Year‚Äôs Xbox Showcase Might Be In Trouble
item.content:encoded:
During last year‚Äôs Xbox Games Showcase, Korea-based developer EVR Studio announced Mudang: Two Hearts, a stealth action-adventure game with a notable resemblance to the Splinter Cell series. Now, the team‚Äôs website appears offline, and reports hint at possible layoffs in the past few months.

As reported by Need4Games, EVR allegedly laid off multiple people due to a lack of funding. The claim is based on a Korean tracking site, which shows the number of employees decreasing from over a hundred to just 22 as of the time of publication.

In addition, sources speaking to Need4Games were reportedly negative about the studio‚Äôs situation, with one of the investors of EVR Studio reportedly saying that Mudang is meant to be released by the end of March 2026, which is also the end of the current fiscal year. ‚ÄúIf we don‚Äôt receive it, the investors will be very upset with the situation, then it will be their meeting,‚Äù reads the report.

The outlet also reported a sudden silence in terms of online presence. EVR‚Äôs official website currently leads to an error message when accessed, and on The Wayback Machine, the latest backups of the site are dated October 23. Over at the studio‚Äôs YouTube channel, the last developer diary‚Äîwhich presented a motion-matching showcase‚Äîwas uploaded back on August 15, and there have been no more updates since.

On LinkedIn, there are at least 34 people associated with the EVR Studio company profile, although several of those profiles are private. All the public profiles, including those of CEO Yongki Yoon, co-founder, director, and executive producer Dong joon Min, art director Bryan ku, and UI designer Jihong Lee, showcase ‚Äúpresent‚Äù in the respective Experience tabs of their profile, indicating they are still employed at the company.

EVR also has a Discord server, which shows over 2,300 members at the time of publication. As of now, the general chat channel is filled with people speculating about the state of the game based on the aforementioned reports, seemingly without an official response from the developer. The latest update, shared via a behind-the-scenes channel, was issued back on August 29.

Back then, EVR said all development divisions were focused on validating the playable build to ensure stability, running regression testing and balance tuning. The team also added that the following dev diary update may experience a slight delay because of these tests. ‚ÄúOur team is fully committed to delivering a level of quality that will be recognized by players worldwide, and we look forward to sharing the next stage of progress with you soon,‚Äù reads the Discord message.

Mudang: Two Hearts is slated to launch in 2026 on PC, PS5, and Xbox consoles. According to EVR, the game hit 100,000 wishlists by July 25 of last year.

Kotaku has reached out to EVR Studio for comment.



https://kotaku.com/mudang-two-hearts-splinter-cell-layoffs-shut-down-release-date-2000656736
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Some Anthem Players Say EA Is Already Blocking Them From Playing The Game A Week Before It Shuts Down
item.content:encoded:
We‚Äôre just one week away from Electronic Arts shutting down Anthem, BioWare‚Äôs questionable 2019 looter shooter detour that failed to take off and never got the second chance the RPG studio had promised. According to the initial announcement, fans who bought the game would still be able to play it up until it finally goes offline forever on January 12. However, as the end date gets closer, some players who are trying to go take their Javelins out for one last spin have discovered they‚Äôre no longer able to open the game.

We first took notice of this after seeing a few posts on X from users with screenshots showing that they were no longer able to download Anthem after previously purchasing it at some point over the past seven years. The EA app instead told them they ‚Äúdon‚Äôt own‚Äù the game. I asked around and a friend who had the game through the EA Play subscription tried to download it to his PC and was told ‚Äúthis game is no longer offered in our catalog.‚Äù

Anthem is shutting down for good in a week, so I thought I'd play one more time.

The EA App won't even let me download it even though I own it. pic.twitter.com/spVNJd9six

‚Äî DansGaming (@Dansgaming) January 5, 2026

As others have also reported, EA won't let me download Anthem, even though it shuts down a week from now‚Ä¶ No "last hurrah" I guess. Crazy that I bought the game and can't even download it while it's still, allegedly, alive‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/cRu0s4DU1N

‚Äî Luke Stephens (@LukeStephens) January 5, 2026

However, this doesn‚Äôt seem to be a universal issue, as Kotaku‚Äôs Ethan Gach was able to download without issue from the EA Play app. 

Whatever the case may be, it seems like at least some Anthem players who may have wanted to give the game one last try before BioWare and EA needlessly send it tumbling down into a digital void aren‚Äôt able to now. The mech shooter hasn‚Äôt  been available for purchase since the original shutdown announcement back in July, but if you had a copy of it in your library or on a disc, you were supposed to have one more week to play it.

We‚Äôve reached out to EA and BioWare for comment on the situation, and will update this story if we hear back. This whole thing could‚Äôve been avoided if BioWare had made Anthem accessible offline, but the studio claims it ‚Äúwas designed to be an online-only title.‚Äù That‚Äôs in contrast to other failed live-service gambits like Redfall and Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League, both of which received offline modes before being sent off to pasture.



https://kotaku.com/anthem-shutdown-download-bioware-ea-pc-app-play-2000656725
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Guy Behind Viral ‚ÄòFocus, M‚Äô Gaming Meme Never Expected It To Spread So Fast
item.content:encoded:
Late last month, an old video showing off what a hypothetical AAA Mario game would look like went viral after two voice actors added new dialogue styled after that in blockbuster games like Uncharted and Gears of War. Now, a few weeks later, one line from the game, ‚ÄúFocus, M,‚Äù has spread across all corners of the web, annoying some and leading to a lot of online discourse.

On December 23, voice actor Ryan Stewart uploaded a video featuring himself as Mario and another voice actor, Ariel Hack, as Peach, talking to each other over comms as the famous plumber approaches Bowser‚Äôs castle. The original gameplay video featured in Stewart‚Äôs post was created by Funkyzeit as a conceptual mock-up of what a AAA Mario game might look like, and was shared online back in 2022. This new version, featuring dialogue perfectly parodying how some AAA games deliver narrative and tutorial information, quickly went viral online, with Stewart‚Äôs Twitter upload reaching over 25 million views as of January 5.

I had no idea AAA Mario would be so popular. I had to make some more. üçÑ
ft. @ArielHck as Peach https://t.co/p3YMlF5rEn pic.twitter.com/ggarxptMuZ

‚Äî Ryan Stewart (@RyanStewartVO) December 21, 2025

Quickly, one phrase from the video became popular: ‚ÄúFocus, M.‚Äù This line is delivered by Hack‚Äôs Peach after Mario makes a joke. It‚Äôs a pitch-perfect replication of the kind of AAA video game dialogue that was so prevalent in blockbuster single-player games from the Xbox 360 and PS4 generations, and which can still be found in some bigger games now. All of this dialogue, including the ‚ÄúFocus, M‚Äù line, was written by Stewart himself, who told Kotaku that while he didn‚Äôt expect the bit to go as viral as it has, he knew he had a ‚Äúbanger‚Äù on his hands once he heard it.

‚ÄúAs I was writing the dialogue, I knew it was funny,‚Äù said Stewart via email. ‚ÄúOnce I got Ariel‚Äôs reads in, though, I knew it would be a banger. That being said, the sheer amount of discussion it spawned after the fact was unexpected.‚Äù

When asked for his thoughts on how ‚ÄúFocus, M‚Äù has become its own meme, with people using it who haven‚Äôt even seen the original video, Stewart told Kotaku:  ‚ÄúIf nothing else, I think it‚Äôs resulted in some excellent fan art! I hope my future posts can do the same.‚Äù

While Stewart is pretty positive about ‚ÄúFocus, M,‚Äù some online aren‚Äôt. The original creator behind the AAA Mario video never replied to Kotaku‚Äôs request for comment, but did like a YouTube comment left by someone comparing them to Oppenheimer, the man who created the nuclear bomb. That seems to indicate that, at the very least, Funkyzeit has mixed feelings about their involvement in ‚ÄúFocus, M.‚Äù

Meanwhile, online, the ‚ÄúFocus, M‚Äù meme has rapidly evolved and spread. You can find people applying it to basically anything at this point. New Marathon graphics? That‚Äôs a ‚ÄúFocus, M‚Äù game. PS1 platformer Croc? That‚Äôs a ‚ÄúFocus, M‚Äù game. Starfield? Sure, whatever, that‚Äôs a ‚ÄúFocus, M‚Äù game, too.

At this point, the meme has already run its course and lost all meaning. It‚Äôs like people calling anything they don‚Äôt like slop. And you can find plenty of posts from people saying they feel the meme is dead already. I‚Äôm not so sure, though. I still regularly see people tagging new AAA games and remasters as ‚ÄúFocus, M‚Äù games. And I suspect that at least a few devs have been watching all of this and are possibly making some tweaks to dialogue in their own upcoming games. I feel certain that at least one game has likely removed or cut a line that asked the player to ‚ÄúFocus‚Ä¶‚Äù in response to all of this.



https://kotaku.com/guy-behind-viral-focus-m-gaming-meme-never-expected-it-to-spread-so-fast-2000656706
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Stranger Things Fans Are Convinced There‚Äôs A Secret Episode That Will ‚ÄòFix‚Äô Disappointing Finale
item.content:encoded:
Stranger Things‚Äô series finale continues to be a lightning rod for controversy. While plenty of people were fine with how the Netflix horror series wrapped up after a decade, there‚Äôs a loud subset of fans who are taking to the digital streets to tear it down, say awful things about the people who worked on it, and declare it the next Game of Thrones-level failure. Another fraction of that group, however, is holding onto a bizarre sliver of hope with the belief that perhaps the disappointing conclusion is not all it seems. The movement, which is calling itself Conformity Gate, has gathered ‚Äúevidence‚Äù indicating that the events depicted in the finale are actually an illusion and that there is still a battle left to fight, which will play out in a secret episode that‚Äôs not available on Netflix right now.

Obviously, we‚Äôll be discussing the fifth season of Stranger Things here, so if you want to stay spoiler free, you should leave now. (Really, you probably shouldn‚Äôt have opened this article to begin with.) But the tl;dr of the theory is that the sterile and rushed nature of the finale is an intentional creative choice meant to reflect that it takes place in a distorted reality created by Vecna and everyone in the show is ‚Äúconforming‚Äù to it. 

Admittedly, I fully planned to just roll my eyes at all this pretty wild speculation because I lived through the Mass Effect 3 ending controversy and the Indoctrination Theory, which fans believed explained that game‚Äôs finale as a hallucination but was really just a way for them to cope with not liking the way things turned out. But, I don‚Äôt know, there‚Äôs some compelling evidence in the theory, both based on what‚Äôs in the show and on how Netflix and show creators the Duffer Brothers have talked about it since. 

Many of these details are subtle, such as the way that characters sit during the graduation scene resembling how villain Vecna sits at other points in the series, whereas others seem to be pretty overt, like Max calling out Mike‚Äôs D&D epilogue for being too comforting, as if something is off. Here‚Äôs one of the quicker rundowns I could find, by @meechski on TikTok, but you can also find much lengthier breakdowns on YouTube.

Also, as someone in the comments of that video points out, if you search ‚Äúconformity gate‚Äù or ‚Äúfake ending‚Äù on Netflix, Stranger Things is the only search result for the latter, and one of two for the former alongside Emily in Paris. Make of that what you will.

I don‚Äôt know that any one thing made me a full-blown believer, but taken all together, it was enough for me to at least become interested in seeing if it actually pans out. Conspiracy theories usually have at least some shred of plausibility that allows them to gain some traction, but they also tend to be made up of a lot of square pegs shoved into round holes. All these pieces of evidence could just be coincidences born of bad writing and desperation. 

guys‚Ä¶ notice how all of them are reading WHITE scripts when shawn levy confirmed the finale was printed on RED scripts‚Ä¶ they are trying to confuse us with that trailer. i AM sure #confirmitygate pic.twitter.com/Pje0LF13dm

‚Äî  Ö«ù…Ø | ‡©à‚ú©‚Äß‚ÇäÀö (@melinastapes) January 5, 2026

Luckily, we won‚Äôt really have to wait long for these hopes to be shattered, as the entire theory hinges on this hypothetical secret finale premiering on January 7, when Netflix is planning to announce something about its 2026 programming. Of course, I don‚Äôt want any Stranger Things fans to have to suffer a worse ending than the one they‚Äôd hoped for, but after witnessing the behavior of some members of the community in the wake of a disappointing finale, I‚Äôm also wondering if those who have said some truly heinous things about the people who worked on this show even deserve a better ending.



https://kotaku.com/stranger-things-secret-finale-conformity-gate-explained-2000656704
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Vampire Survivors Remade In Hytale Shows Why So Many Players Are Hyped For The Minecraft Rival
item.content:encoded:
Hypixel Studios, developer of the Minecraft-inspired survival game Hytale, has shown the sandbox game‚Äôs modding capabilities with a Vampire Survivors-like prototype that has fans excited ahead of the game‚Äôs Early Access launch later this month. In a social media post over the weekend, Hypixel co-founder Simon Collins-Laflamme shared a 40-second gameplay clip showcasing a character fending off voxel-based hordes of enemies in a top-down view arena.

According to Collins-Laflamme, the video shows a Hytale mod created by a team member in their spare time, and it‚Äôs intended as a proof-of-concept demo for ‚Äúhow different genres‚Äù could be realized within the game by fans and modders.

The following video showcases a server-side Hytale mod created by a Hytale team member in their spare time. It‚Äôs intended purely as inspiration for how different genres could be realized within Hytale!

The gameplay shown represents only a small subset of our modding‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/YaszQv9kDb

‚Äî Simon (@Simon_Hypixel) January 4, 2026

‚ÄúThe gameplay shown represents only a small subset of our modding capabilities and was used to build a simple, survivor-like experience,‚Äù Collins-Laflamme wrote. While the mod is not planned for release as part of the game, Hypixel ‚Äúmay publish it ‚Äì or similar examples ‚Äì as reference material for the community.‚Äù

The video comes less than two months after Hypixel reacquired the rights to Hytale from League of Legends maker Riot Games, which had previously canceled the project in June of last year. The team released a 16-minute gameplay trailer shortly afterwards, but the latest clip is focused on Hytale‚Äôs potential to be a springboard for user-generated content like the Mojang hit that inspired it.

Hytale is gearing up for Early Access

‚ÄúMy prediction is, it will do very well initially and then it will slow down until the modders / servers and us start to release some major content and then it will keep growing for years to come. Especially as we add more modding tools and options,‚Äù Collins-Laflamme wrote on X, responding to a user who suggested that Hytale‚Äôs release ‚Äúwill probably be something huge.‚Äù

The reply came from a larger thread in which the co-founder expressed feeling ‚Äúanger‚Äù as the studio gets closer to the early access launch of this new version of Hytale, which is slated for January 13. According to Collins-Laflamme, that‚Äôs due to pouring four years of engineering into rebuilding the game‚Äôs engine rather than working on gameplay features. In his eyes, that leaves the team with a ‚Äúfour-year gap and a lot of catching up to do,‚Äù alongside a rebuilt engine that is ‚Äúnever gonna be used.‚Äù

As previously stated by the developer in a FAQ, the sandbox won‚Äôt be available on Steam at launch in order to focus on its existing community. That‚Äôs to avoid chasing ‚Äúa flood of cold first impressions that could overcorrect the game‚Äôs direction.‚Äù Hypixel explained that while it doesn‚Äôt shy away from ‚Äúhonest, negative criticism,‚Äù the team is more interested in feedback from players who are already familiar with the game‚Äôs development background.

Most importantly, the FAQ notes that Steam ‚Äúcurrently doesn‚Äôt support‚Äù some of Hytale‚Äôs modding features, and that the developer ‚Äúwill be in contact with Valve in the near future‚Äù to try and fix that. Otherwise it might be a while before Steam users get to recreate the platform‚Äôs latest hits inside Hytale.



https://kotaku.com/hytale-vampire-survivors-mod-early-access-steam-minecraft-2000656708
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot
